title: Procurement Officer Job at PC Planet Limited
content:
PC Planet Limited is Nigeria’s leading Online IT vendor, offering a large variety of IT products and services, at unbeatable low prices while providing our customers a superior and exciting shopping experience.

We are recruiting to fill the position below:

Job Position: Procurement Officer

Job Location: Ikeja, Lagos
Job Type: Full-time

Key Responsibilities
     

        


     (adsbygoogle = window.adsbygoogle || []).push({});
    
    




	Source and negotiate with vendors and suppliers for quality products and competitive pricing
	Review and analyze purchase requests, quotations, and specifications
	Process and manage purchase orders, invoices, and delivery timelines
	Ensure compliance with company procurement policies and industry best practices
	Evaluate vendor performance and recommend improvements or alternatives
	Monitor stock levels and place orders as needed to avoid shortages or overstocking
	Maintain accurate records of purchases, pricing, delivery, and inventory
	Work closely with the finance, sales, and technical teams to ensure operational alignment
	Stay updated on market trends and potential suppliers.


Requirements


	A Bachelor’s Degree or equivalent from a recognized institution
	Minimum of 1–3 years of relevant experience in procurement or supply chain
	Strong analytical and negotiation skills
	Excellent verbal and written communication skills
	Familiarity with ICT/computer hardware products is an added advantage
	Proficient in Microsoft Excel, Google Workspace, and digital communication tools
	Strong attention to detail and organizational skills
	Ability to work independently and within a team
	Must reside in or around Ikeja or be willing to relocate


Salary
N150,000 - N200,000 / month.

Method of Application
Interested and qualified candidates should send their CV to: hr@pcplaceng.com using the Job Position as the subject of the mail.

title: Accountant Job at R.A Think Design
content:
R.A Think Design is Nigeria's foremost manufacturer of custom interior designs. R.A. Think Design is an Israeli-Nigerian Interior Design and Custom-made Furniture company that caters to commercial and residential projects.

We are recruiting to fill the position below:

Job Position: Accountant

Job Location: Ketu Ikosi, Lagos
Employment Type: Full-time

Job Descriptions
     

        


     (adsbygoogle = window.adsbygoogle || []).push({});
    
    




	Develop and manage budgets, forecasts, and financial models.
	Analyze financial performance and provide insights to senior management.
	Identify areas for cost reduction and efficiency improvements, especially in production and logistics.
	Monitor and analyze inventory costs, stock levels, and wastage.
	Work closely with production and procurement to ensure cost-effective operations.
	Implement costing strategies for raw materials and finished goods.
	Oversee daily accounting operations including AP/AR, general ledger, and payroll.
	Ensure accurate and timely preparation of monthly, quarterly, and annual financial reports.
	Maintain compliance with local tax laws, regulations, and accounting standards.
	Monitor cash flow to ensure sufficient liquidity for operations.
	Manage banking relationships, payment processing, and cash forecasting.
	Establish and enforce strong internal controls and audit trails.
	Ensure compliance with company policies, government regulations, and industry standards.
	Liaise with external auditors and regulatory bodies.
	Provide financial insights for strategic decisions (e.g., expansion, pricing, new product lines).
	Support management in long-term business planning and investment decisions.
	Contribute to procurement and pricing strategies, especially for raw materials and imported items.
	Supervise junior finance staff and accountants.
	Train and mentor the finance team to improve efficiency and accuracy.
	Foster collaboration between finance, operations, sales, and production departments.


Job Requirements


	B.Sc / MSc in Accounting, or related field
	3 years of experience in the field preferably manufacturing industry
	professional certified (ICAN), (ACCA)
	Filing of corporate tax returns.
	Experience in providing financial advice.
	Experience in Financial Auditing
	Knowledge of SAGE, QuickBooks and other accounting software
	Detail Oriented and good analytical skills
	Diligent and honest.


Method of Application
Interested and qualified candidates should send their CV to: admin@ra-nigeria.com using the Job Position as the subject of the mail.

title: Technical Procurement Officer Job at Eunisell Limited
content:
Eunisell Limited is a specialty chemicals and engineering solutions company, supplying key chemicals and production solutions to a wide range of customers operating in the downstream oil and gas, automotive and industrial sectors in Africa.

We are a market leader in designing, formulating and producing oilfield chemicals for production and completions applications. With a focus on delivering differentiated chemical technologies to drive performance, we support customers and projects in 5 deep-water assets in Nigeria.

We are recruiting to fill the position below:

Job Position: Technical Procurement Officer

Job Location: Rivers
Employment Type: Full-time
     

        


     (adsbygoogle = window.adsbygoogle || []).push({});
    
    



Key Job Responsibilities


	Responsible for strategic sourcing, negotiation and procurement of engineering/technical equipment, materials,consumables, machines, services, and projects.
	The job holder will work closely with internal stakeholders, suppliers, and vendors to ensure the timely and cost-effective acquisition of high-quality technical products and services.


Essential Duties And Responsibilities


	Ensures prompt procurement of engineering spares, consumables, equipment, machines, services and projects in line with company’s procurement policy.
	Liaises with user departments and suppliers to ensure that items/services procured meet required specifications.
	Conducts regular market/price intelligence survey to ensure competitiveness on items and services procured.
	Ensures purchase orders are executed promptly as required to foster effective delivery of purchased materials/services for uninterrupted operations.
	Works with a cross-functional team to schedule and monitor assigned projects and ensure they are completed within the stipulated budget and time frame.
	Prepares monthly reports on procurement activities.
	Any other responsibility as assigned from time to time
	Develop service level agreements with vendors and contractors.
	Conducts the annual vendors’/contractors’ performance evaluation process, prepares the performance evaluation report and gives recommendations to concerned stakeholders.
	Establishes mutually beneficial, ethical and healthy relationships with vendors/contractors to achieve quality standards and improvements on a continuous basis.
	Source, evaluate, and select suppliers for technical equipment, materials, and services.
	Monitor and track orders to ensure timely delivery and resolve any issues or delays.


Competencies Required For The Role:


	In-depth knowledge of best practices in procurement and supply chain management
	Excellent oral and written communication skills
	Strong negotiation skill
	Must have an eye for detail, a drive for efficiency, and a passion for creativity and innovation
	Able to establish and maintain effective working relationships with external and internal stakeholders
	Analytical and Proactive
	Proficient in the use of Microsoft Office Suite, ERP – Microsoft Navision


Qualification


	A Bachelor’s Degree or HND qualification in Engineering or related discipline.
	Minimum of 4 years of cognate experience in similar role.
	Membership of relevant Professional bodies.
	Strong understanding of technical products, equipment, and services within the oil & gas & engineering sector.
	Strong analytical and problem-solving skills, with the ability to make data-driven decisions.
	Highly organized, detail-oriented, and able to manage multiple tasks simultaneously.
	Knowledge of industry regulations and best practices in procurement


Method of Application
Interested and qualified candidates should send their updated CV to recruitment@eunisell.com using the Job Position as the subject of their mail

title: Restaurant Manager Job at Greystone Consulting Limited
content:
Greystone Consulting Limited - Our client, a fast growing Restaurant company, is recruiting to fill the position below:

Job Position: Restaurant Manager
Job Location: Ejigbo, Lagos
Employment Type: Full-time

Job Summary
     

        


     (adsbygoogle = window.adsbygoogle || []).push({});
    
    




	Are you passionate about food, customer service, and leading high-performing teams?
	Our client is hiring a Restaurant Manager to oversee the daily operations of our fast-food restaurant in Lagos.
	If you’re goal-driven, energetic, and thrive in a fast-paced environment, we’d love to meet you!
	Our client is looking to add a Restaurant manager that would be responsible for driving revenue growth by identifying new business opportunities, maintaining relationships with clients, and promoting the restaurant’s offerings to corporate and individual customers.
	This role combines sales expertise with deep knowledge of food and hospitality services to increase brand visibility and boost customer engagement.


Key Responsibilities


	Lead and supervise daily restaurant operations to ensure smooth service
	Drive customer satisfaction through excellent service delivery
	Manage staff scheduling, training, and performance
	Maintain high standards of food quality, hygiene, and safety
	Monitor inventory and manage stock levels efficiently
	Handle customer complaints promptly and professionally
	Achieve sales targets and manage budgetary controls.


Requirements


	Minimum of OND / HND / BSc in Hospitality, Business, or related field
	At least 2 years of experience in a supervisory/managerial role in a fast-food or hospitality setting
	Strong leadership and people management skills
	Sound knowledge of food safety and quality standards
	Excellent communication and problem-solving skills
	Ability to multitask and work under pressure.


Method of Application
Interested and qualified candidates can send their CVs to: consultgreystone@gmail.com using the Job Position as the subject of the email.
